annotation: Although it looks a direct possessed noun, it takes a subject prefix: ka-ɛsmaɔnɛ-k, 1sg.sbj-breath-1sg.poss. 'I breathe'

language: East Sumbanese, Umbu Ratu Nggai dialect
Kadazan Dusun of Taginambur, Kota Belud, Sabah, Malaysia

annotation: Lit. his heart is pumping; also nua-na e-veli
breathe; looks like a possible loan from Lengo given the sound correspondences
This is a noun 'breath'. I couldn't find the specific verb that is used w/ it.
E has diagonal line through (forward slash)
(sortir la tête de l'eau pour respirer, comme la tortue)
said to be borrowed from Gela
mo-  prefix; perhaps the root contains a frozen  -in- infix
prefix loan from GCPhil, root Malay
